page.syntax: as P = a5_CreatePassiveLinkTable([* dsSpec [,* OpenConnection [,L suppressErrorMessages [,L addTableToDB [,L showProgress [,L allowCancel [,* argsPassedIn [,* CreateOptions ]]]]]]]])

argument.name: P
argument.description: A pointer to the new table. The pointer has these subelements. .ErrorText = character error message .HasError = logical error flag

argument.name: dsSpec
argument.description: Optional. Default = NULL_VALUE(). A pointer containing a .DataSource property.

argument.name: OpenConnection
argument.description: Optional. Default = NULL_VALUE(). A SQL::Connection object.

argument.name: suppressErrorMessages
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .F.
.F. = Display error messages.
.T. = Hide error messages.

argument.name: addTableToDB
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .T.
.T. = Add table to database
.F. = Just create table, but do not add it to database.

page.description: Displays dialog for creating a Passive-Link table.
page.discussion: The A5_CreatePassiveLinkTable() function displays the Specify DataSource dialog. With this dialog you specify a SQL SELECT query that retrieves data from a SQL database. Limitations: Desktop applications only.
